list_definition.definition: a short stop, break or interval (while doing something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a pause in the conversation.

list_definition.definition: the act of making a musical note or rest slightly longer than normal, or a mark showing that this is to be done.
to stop talking, working etc for a short time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They paused for a cup of tea.

list_ex_of_english: Perceptible pauses were marked in the transciptions, but were not measured individually in milliseconds.
He stopped walking and the creature paused and turned.
She pauses more often than in the other oral version and creates more lines than the written version.
In particular, word boundaries do not correspond at all consistently to pauses in production.
Here he paused, but he wanted to go on.
She looked at me, paused for a moment, and then continued.
Nonwords were presented individually, pausing the tape in between each nonword to allow the participant unlimited time to attempt to repeat the item.
An utterance was defined as a statement bound by pauses containing one verb.
